ISSUE.TITLE: Use configuration classes instead of @Value annotations
ISSUE.DESCRIPTION: ## Current Implementation Configuration values are injected via `@Value`. ## Suggested Enhancement Implement a ConfigurationService. See https://github.com/corona-warn-app/cwa-server/issues/183 ## Expected Benefits * central configration definition for better maintainability * fast failure on startup, if non-optional values are missing. * ability to use primitive values instead of wrapper types without higher chance of accidental default value usage (see #86)

COMMIT.MESSAGE: fixes #88 Adds a nested spring configuration class that reads in values from application.yml. All places where @value annotations were used now use the configuration class. Maybe it makes sense to add comments to the configuration class values, describing their significance?
